channel.title: Qubes News: Qubes 3.0-rc1 ISO and roadmap for 2015
channel.description:
[b]Qubes News: Qubes 3.0-rc1 ISO and roadmap for 2015[/b]
[hr]
Joanna (Qubes founder) has posted a new announcement of the new Qubes 3.0-rc1 and additional items.
Link to the announcement is here:
[b]http://blog.invisiblethings.org/2015/04/23/qubes-30rc1-and-roadmap.html[/b]
[b]Whonix Notice:[/b] Our Whonix templates are currently not in the Qubes 3.0 binary repository, so you will not yet be able to use our Binary Install Guide in Qubes 3.0-rc1. This should be updated soon in the near-term future and then you will be able to easily install Whonix in Qubes 3.0.
[u]Summary[/u]
- Qubes 3.0-rc1 is now released --> https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/QubesDownloads
- New hypervisor abstraction layer (HAL) architecture --> http://blog.invisiblethings.org/2013/03/21/introducing-qubes-odyssey-framework.html
- Upgraded hypervisor to Xen 4.4 from 4.1
- Upgraded main VM template to Fedora 21 from 20
- Official ITL supported Debian 8 Jessie and Debian 7 Wheezy binary VM templates --> https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/Templates/Debian
- Even more VM templates available via QubesBuilder --> https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/QubesBuilder
- New qrexec2 framework --> https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/Qrexec3Implementation
- Progress on defensive development to guard from development-related exploits
- Hat tip to our own Patrick Schleizer's implementation of verifiable builds
- Qubes devs are looking for Tor-based QubesBuilder code contribution
- Plans for 2015, including Qubes 3.X and Qubes 4.X
- New Qubes roadmap diagram --> https://www.whonix.org/forum/index.php/topic,1153.0.html
- Newly designed and decentralized Git-backed Qubes website --> https://www.qubes-os.org
- Transition of Joanna (Qubes founder) to new project while remaining head of Qubes planning, and Marek continues as lead developer and signs new Qubes releases
- and more!
